references.paper_title: Overcoming catastrophic forgetting in neural networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of continual learning, introducing the concept of catastrophic forgetting and proposing methods to mitigate it.
This work introduces the concept of synaptic intelligence as a mechanism for continual learning, and presents an approach to achieve it.
This paper proposes a novel approach to class-incremental learning using generative classifiers, providing a solution to the task confusion problem.

references.paper_title: Continual learning with deep generative replay
references.reason: This work introduces deep generative replay as a technique for continual learning, effectively addressing catastrophic forgetting through data generation.

references.paper_title: iCaRL: Incremental classifier and representation learning
references.reason: This paper introduces iCaRL, a prominent class-incremental learning algorithm that combines incremental learning with representation learning, which is relevant to the topic of this paper.
